item.title: By: Andrew Simmons
item.dc:creator: Andrew Simmons
item.description: <p>Is there info on a launcher and quick silver app that uses the new vista control bar features?</p>
item.content:encoded: Is there info on a launcher and quick silver app that uses the new vista control bar features?

item.title: By: Mischa
item.dc:creator: Mischa
item.description: <p>The main difference that i find between these and the actual spotlight is that spotlight would search in the document not just the name for what you are searching for. So say if you have multiple .doc that talk about a guy named John and none were named John it would find the .doc 's that have john in the actual text and highlight it for you </p>
item.content:encoded: The main difference that i find between these and the actual spotlight is that spotlight would search in the document not just the name for what you are searching for. So say if you have multiple .doc that talk about a guy named John and none were named John it would find the .doc ‘s that have john in the actual text and highlight it for you

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Nice one Steve and Josh,</p><p>Keep them coming guys. Although they are OK, there still doesn't seem to be anything which even comes close to QuickSilver of Spotlight.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Nice one Steve and Josh,

Keep them coming guys. Although they are OK, there still doesn’t seem to be anything which even comes close to QuickSilver of Spotlight.

item.title: By: Josh

item.description: <p>Launchy is a free alternative. item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description: <p>PC-Com is another useful program for Windows. It can do almost everything that Quicksilver can, and it even has a few extra features, like a macro recorder and note creator. You can find PC-Com at www.boletrice.com/pccom.</p>
item.content:encoded: PC-Com is another useful program for Windows. It can do almost everything that Quicksilver can, and it even has a few extra features, like a macro recorder and note creator. You can find PC-Com at http://www.boletrice.com/pccom.
